title: HIGH PC GAME RIG = CHALLENGER?
body:
Well, I have thought about this thing but im not sure if I can support my statement ver well. 
I might sound stupid but I think im making sense at all about this. so here it goes...

Having a better gaming RIG or better pc build up sure gives players a better gaming performance
which makes players a better player for getting accurate frames and play without lagging at all.

**GOOD GAMING RIG really means IT MAKES YOU A BETTER PLAYER?
**
thank you.
(p.s. i was in bronze and got to silver and stayed in silver)
which i believe because of poor gaming experience due to
poor pc quality build up.

Ive seen clips on yt about how to build the most gaming rig possible out there. 
and yeah, i just want to make a point about those who are in gold and up in rank uses a toaster or not.
for my case,  i was once a bronze and i decided to upgrade to a mac and i just think that its a mac, 
things are gonna be smoother as it is. i got up to silver but with all the updates and everything and since mac isnt a 
gaming rig, the lags and slows during clashes and errything gets worse by the minute. 

so yeah. im planning to sell my mac now and get at least an 700$ worth build gaming rig that even battlefield or far cry can be played 
without frames dropping too much. 

thanks for yall inputs and opinions
i really do appreciate things and all. thanks.

For 1k..? I play on near high settings and I only paid 800, about 130 was shipping and taxes. >> Actual computer was only 670 and I built it on Cyberpower, which is known to be a very expensive website for building a computer, lol.

If you are comparing a "toaster" to a high powered gaming pc then yes. probably. However if you are comparing an average computer to a high powered one, no not really. There is a line where it would effect, however if you can run the game fine with low graphics it should not make a difference if you play on a computer that can run high graphics. 

It is more about how bad the computer is instead of how good.

Having a PC that doesn't drop frames and runs everything on Max on a high resolution will let you react and see better, so yes, it does make you better. You won't find a challenger on a toaster.

But no, it doesn't fix you being trash. It only allows good players to play optimally.
You need skill more than a good PC, you could be playing on a super computer but it won't make a difference if you have 16 CS at 10 minutes
